ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Weapon selections..
ygData.msgSnippet: YAK in primary.  It will proc a LOT more there (esp if you have high dex). Your dex bonus isn t applied to your off-hand. Also, since the Yak is slightly
ygData.messageBody:
YAK in primary. It will proc a LOT more there (esp if you have high dex).
Your dex bonus isn't applied to your off-hand.

Also, since the Yak is slightly faster (hardly at all tho) you'll balance
out the (very slight) damage difference by getting to apply your strength
bonus more often. And since the yak will proc far more often (if you have
dex over 100) in your primary hand you'll more than make up for the
difference in dmg with the additional procs you'll see.

Good luck! I would also recommend a Sionache's partisan instead of the Yak
;) It's 9/19 and some pretty impressive stat bonuses.

When I'm actually using melee I use a Sionache's partisan and a Saeiny's
Claw.

Lyrnia Jongleur
(yeah, I'd like to upgrade the Claw, just haven't had the time)
----- Original Message -----
From: <hho@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, August 28, 2000 4:00 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Weapon selections..


> Hi all,
> Well its time for me to call upon the experinced souls here to get some
advice
> regarding weapons. I have the following weapons at my disposal:
> - Ebon Razor (Primary only) Damage 9, Delay 25, +4 fire, cold & magic
prot. Wt.
> 3.5.
> - Short Sword of the Ykesha: Damage 8, Delay 24, Weight 4.5. Effect of
Ykesha
> (75 point direct damage spell)
> - Staff of Writhing 9/33 Diret proc Damage 48
> - Bladed thullian claws (Primary only). 5/19
> - Silvery War Axe 6/22
> Currently Im wielding the Ebon Razor and the yak and I think my damage is
better
> than with the yak in primary and Silvery in off hand. But I have my
doubts. Im
> not satisfied with the yak being placed in my offhand. Do any of you have
> suggestions for a better weapon setup?
> I have been thinking of getting a second yak, but I find the proc is
resisted
> quite a lot by kunark mobs atleast.
>
> Regards
> Musiker(x) Silverdrum, bard of the 38th song, bertox
>

with the subject submissions.
